title: HIPPOPODES
content:
THE HIPPOPODES were a tribe of horse-footed men who lived on the cold islands beyond Skythia in the far north.
        Their name means "Horse-Footed" from the Greek words hippos and pous.

Pliny the Elder, Natural History 4. 94 (trans. Rackham) (Roman encyclopedia C1st
          A.D.) :
        "Crossing the Ripaean Mountains [probably the Carpathians in central Europe] must coast to the left along
        the shore of the northern ocean until we reach Gadis. In this direction a number of islands are reported to
        exist [perhaps in the Baltic Sea] . . . [and] the Hippopodes on which people are born with horses' feet, which
        gives them their Greek name."

A complete bibliography of the translations quoted on this page.
